Perelman's entropy and doubling property on Riemannian
manifolds
Fabrice Baudoin, Nicola Garofalo
September 4, 2018

Abstract
The purpose of this work is to study some monotone functionals of the heat kernel
on a complete Riemannian manifold with nonnegative Ricci curvature. In particular,
we show that on these manifolds, the gradient estimate of Li and Yau [8], the gradient
estimate of Ni [6], the monotonicity of the Perelman's entropy and the volume doubling
property are all consequences of an entropy inequality recently discovered in [3]. The
latter is a linearized version of a logarithmic Sobolev inequality that is due to D. Bakry
and M. Ledoux [1].

1

The purpose of this work is to show that the above cited results may actually be seen as
consequences of a new linearized version, found in [3], of a logarithmic Sobolev inequality
that is due to Bakry and Ledoux [1]. In particular, we will obtain a new proof of the
volume doubling property (1.1) that does not rely on the Laplacian comparison theorem
(1.2). It is our hope, and the primary motivation of the present work, that the techniques
developed here may apply to situations, such as complete sub-Riemannian manifolds,
where a Laplacian comparison theorem is not available. On the other hand, it has been
recently shown in [3], that on such manifolds there is a notion of Ricci tensor which
generalizes its Riemannian predecessor, and that one can successfully develop a theory
that parallels the Riemannian one.
Finally, we observe that as a by-product of our work we obtain seemingly new global heat
kernel bounds on complete Riemannian manifolds with strictly positive Ricci curvature.
